Top Review:
***Review on 12th day after Delivery***When the dish washer was delivered, I took my time to explore what is in dish washer. Based on reviews posted here as well as reviews available on Youtube, I knew that this dish washer was apt for my small family of 3 members including a toddler.Installation:* We need to get the plumbing done and get a tap fitted that is compatible with washing machines or dish washers.* The inlet pipe provided out of the box is not the one I used. I went for another pipe purchased from market. Here is why: 1. The end that attaches to tap has only threaded fitting. 2. This means that the tap can only be used for dish washer alone. Because to use the same tap for other purposes, would imply undoing the threading of inlet pipe attached to tap. 3. This threading of pipe is plastic. More you play with it, more are the chances of you having some leakage issues. This insight was provided to me by the installation guy.* The pipe I used had a better attachment on the tap side: 1. It had that metal attachment which has the threading to which inlet pipe out of the box or any other washing machine or dish washer inlet pipes can be attached. 2. Then it has its own plastic threaded attachment that can be easily detached from inlet pipe. 3. Inlet pipe that I bought has its own spring based locking and unlocking mechanism to attach itself to this intermediate threaded plastic attachment which connects to the metal threaded spout of the tap.* Ensure that when you order this dish washer, you have it delivered after you have the delivery of dish washer detergent, rins aid and dish washer salt. Please order those items such that they are delivered to you before the dish washer.* Electricity input that the dish washer needs must be 15 amp. Please do not change the pin to match 5 amp input.* The dish washer comes with a funnel which can be used to fill salt and may be rins aid. I haven't really bought rins aid as I went for Finish powerball tablets. These tablets and alike varieties have salt, rins aid and detergent all packed in one tablet.* I still went in for dish washer salt just to be on safe side. In next couple of monthes we will be having summer season. My society at times faces water shortage in summer and that time water is bought out from tanker suppliers. This water source which is not corporation water source is most likely ground water which is far harder than corporation water.* On this page, you will get manual pdf to download. I strongly recommend to download it and read it. Gives you a lot of clarity on what needs to be ensured for the dish washer to be installed, used and maintained.* You will need to buy stand for dish washer separately. Ensure that is ordered before dish washer reaches you.Usage:* Initially, I struggled with arranging my utencils but as other reviews suggest, that can be perfected with practice.* Ensure that utencils are spaced out and are not overlapping entirely. Overlapping utencils will not let water jets wash the utencil covered up.* Ensure all the time that all food particles go to your dust bin and do not accompany your utencils into the dish washer. I've read that these food particles will block your outlet over the period of time giving you some error.* after arranging utencils in dish washer, always rotate both the water jet fans to ensure no utencil is blocking their path.* In case of large plates, you can arrange them at the back of lower basket facing to the front of dish washer. this way large plates stay out of the way of these fans.* You can also arrange them in front or side of basket. But be careful of 2 scenarios: Scenario 1. Obstruction to detergent compartment lead 1. The large plate placed in front of basket can stay out of the way of the fan but can obstruct the detergent compartment to open fully. Yes - detergent compartment opens automatically by water pressure may be to let detergent get mixed with water during a wash cycle. 2. As I am using tablet and not detergent powder, in such scenario, I have placed tablet in compartment but kept the lead of detergent compartment open taking care that I close the dish washer slowly preventing the tablet from falling. 3. Now there is no question of the large plate in front side of basket preventing from detergent compartment lead from opening. Scenario 2. Obstruction to steam inlet. 1. In case you keep the large plate on your left hand side of basket, it may come in way of the steam inlet. 2. I haven't had my plates completely obstructing the steam inlet. I have neither had any impact on the heating process. 3. But in rare cases may be this steam inlet on left hand dish washer wall may get obstructed.* Plastic not compatible with dish washer can change its shape as all utencils are washed in very hot water (70 digree centigrade). Go for steel utencils or glass utencils.* Do not go for glass objects like wine glass which have narrow and weak stem. This weak stem might break inside in case the wine glass were to topple over with water pressure. Cleaning that mess will be certainly challenging. I saw this in a youtube video.* The dish washer does not dry up the utencils entirely like other larger models would. I guess for a table top model it is kind of ok in this drying aspect. Do not expect perfection here.* But your steel cups which at times have water trapped between those 2 layers will be benefited for sure. all that trapped water evapourates away.* things like cutting pad, tea strainer get cleaned far better than any human would clean them up. Water reaches all corners and crevices.* Intensive, normal and eco modes are good at washing milk vessels and kadhais. After wash, in case stains were to nasty, a very light hand scrubbing may be needed.* As the size of dish washer is small, I have almost always needed 2 wash cycles per day to have all my daily utencils washed.Running costs:* In Pune in my locality, as on date I'm writing this review, expence for domestic made to wash utencils is 25 rupees per day. Which is kind of 800 rupees per month.* Finish Powerball Classic tablets which seem to be the reasonable of all other Finish tablets, especially when baught in large quantities, cost you 12.8 rupees per tablet. Buy packet of 110 tablets which would cost around 1400 rupees. One wash can easily be done using only half of this tablet. With 2 washes per day, you will have cost of 12.8 rupees per day.* With dish washer, expect your monthly electricity bill to jump up by 300 to 500 rupees per month. This means per day cost could be between 10 to 15 rupees.* On-going costs overall could be 27-28 rupees per day which is 840 rupees per month.* I expect this 20k dish washer to be with me for next 10 years. I know I'm optimistic here. But my cost is then 2k per year which is around 165 rupees per month.* Add this cost to 840 rupees and we are getting to around 1k per month running expense.* I consider this higher price to be the price I pay for consistancy in wash quality. This is far better than domestic help who has fluctuating quality performance. All this is also less stressful because you don't have to put your head at monitoring domestic help's performance and continuously instructing her time and again.Error Codes:* I have not encountered any error so far. But these are early days. I'll get back with details when I get those errors.* But I did observe some of the question and answers and reviews making mention of e3, e4 and e1 errors.* First of all, I got the installation done of dish washer on my own by arranging for plumber and electrician. The installation guy turned up on 5th day. He did not do the installation as it was already done. I still called him over to get few queries answered. But this guy helped me in understanding what those error codes are. Luckily, this installation guy was having experience of installing 60-70 units of the same dish washer.* E3 error occurs when heater faces issues. At installation time, check whether your earthing is working right. Any electrical fault would affect electrical components within dish washer. This is true for any dish washer.* Clean your dish washer once in month. This prevents salts from gathering around metal surface inside the dish washer including the door frame. When door frame will have salt deposites, there could be possible leakages of water. Using vinegar in one empty washing cycle immediately followed by use of baking soda in another empty washing cycle will help keep the dish washer clean from inside. Cleaning dish washer will prevent errors like e4 or e1 which indicate blockage in outlet.* please keep the filter at bottom of dish washer also clean to avoid above errors.

Product Name: Havells Swing 300mm Wall Fan (Off White)
About: About this item    Elegantly designed fan base. Rated Voltage 230 V;120 ribs guard    Pull cord control for speed and oscillation on-off;Aerodynamically designed and balanced blades    Speed: 1330 RPM;Air Delivery: 45 CMM    Power: 45 watts;Warranty: 2 years on product; Oscillation degree 60 ?    Mounting Type: Wall Mount; Controller Type: Pull Chain Control
Top Review:
I earlier had a 200mm high-speed fan for the kitchen, but it burst into fire one day. I searched for wall fans considering space constraints and settled for a 300mm model.So far, this fan is serving its purpose and working well (Mostly, I use it at full speed as the air requirement is at around 6ft to 7ft distance). But yes, don't miss out on the details below and the final verdict.•••••••••••••••••••🎁 INSIDE BOX•••••••••••••••••••The fan comes in a disassembled state, but it is pretty easy to assemble, owing to a modular design. You can follow the manual, or I have also included my version of the instructions here.1. Base assembly with motor, plastic nut to secure back side grill, and shaft cap or spinner to lock the blade2. Screw and pvc gitti- 2nos each3. Front and back grill4. Plastic guard ring to fix and lock the grills/guard5. Wall clamp6. Warranty card/ Instruction manual in the same leaflet••••••••••••➕ PROS••••••••••••1. Modular design (I remember the previous generation of wall fans and the level of difficulty in assembling those)2. Sturdy and elegant design with metal guards and plastic body3. Good for air delivery up to 10ft. So small kitchens, washrooms, office cubicles, etc can be easily covered4. Has sufficient tilt for the said purposes (It can easily tilt vertically till 45 degrees from the vertical axis)5. Has a lock nut to secure its position while setting tilt (It has stepped slots for different tilt angles, so slipping possibility is minimal)6. Covers 60 degrees horizontal swing7. Pull down rope-based swing and speed control for easy access••••••••••••➖ CONS••••••••••••1. Airflow could have been better (~50 to 60 CFM- Cubic feet per min). Currently, its ~40 CFM, which is a bit low, as opposed to ~70 CFM for the 400mm model2. Swing rope requires extra effort, and you may confuse it for not working if you don't pull with force3. You end up paying a similar price for this 300mm fan as a 400mm one but ~50% lesser airflowFor the said cons, I will deduct 2 stars. But in any case, it's a 3-star device, as it is well suited for its intended usage in small rooms. There is a lot of room for improvement in price and performance.•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••⚙️ ASSEMBLY AND INSTALLATION•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••1. First check first if you have all the pieces to assemble2. Unscrew the spinner (used to fix the blade)3. Unscrew the plastic nut on the motor front (near the base of the visible shaft)4. Fix the rear guard by aligning the grooves to the motor base and use the plastic nut to secure it in place5. Gently push the blade on the shaft by aligning the pin on the shaft to a similar groove on the back side of the hole on the blade6. Once the blade is fully in, tighten the spinner on visible area of the shaft7. Loosen the plastic guard ring and put the front grill on top of the back grill8. Align both grills and ring, and tighten the screw on the ring9. Select the location and mark the mounting bracket's holes on the wall10. Drill and fix fan on the wallP.S. Don't tighten any of the plastic nut, spinner, or ring screw beyond a point; otherwise, it may slip. You need to find the threshold intuitively.••••••••••••••••🎛️ CONTROLS••••••••••••••••1. Set the inclination after loosening the knob on the right side of the motor, following the direction displayed2. Tighten the knob by rotating it in the direction displayed3. Use the left thread to switch on/off swing4. Use the right thread to switch the fan on/off and control the speed••••••••••••••••🏆 VERDICT••••••••••••••••This fan works ok if the room/cubicle size is small (within 7 ft x 7 ft dimension) and is a recommended buy.But, if space is not a constraint for the size of the fan, then definitely go for the 400mm model, as it offers 75% more airflow for the same price.

Top Review:
I bought "Havells 3lts Instant Geyser 4.5KW White/Blue" and I'm really happy I made this decision.Let me start with why I went for "Instant Geyser" instead of "Storage Geyser".-Storage geyser's have a tank to store water and heat it.-For example a 10litre storage geyser fills up the 10 litre tank and then heats the water.-As it has to heat high volume (10 lts) of water it takes time of about 5 to 10 minutes-Instant geyser's on the other hand heat water instantly within 1 to 3 minutes-However the catch is they dont have a huge capacity tank which means at a given instant it has only small volume(depending on tank capacity) of hot waterNow who should opt for "Instant Geyser" and who should opt for "Storage Geyser" is the question ?- If you like to have a "Shower Bath" for which you require more than 10 litres of hot water continously then you should go for "Storage Geyser" since storage geyser of capacity more than 10lts will store 10lts of hot water and provide it to you as soon as you turn on the shower without any pauses-Instead if we consider "Instant Geyser" of 3lts capacity for shower bath, it cant provide you 10lts of hot water continously because for every 3lts it takes time to heat water again-Hence for a shower bath better to go for "Storage Geysers"-If you like to have a "Bathtub Bath" then instant geyser's are good to go because-Consider using a bathtub, a bathtub generally is of capacity 350lts-If you even use a "Storage Geyser" of high capacity as much as 25lts, still you will have 14 pauses of 5 to 10minutes each-Because at one shot this storage geyser can provide you only 25lts of hot water continously and then you will have to wait for 5-10mins for the next 25lts to heat-So to fill the entire bath tub, you need to have 14 times 25lts of hot water = 350lts-So the total wait time would be 14 times 7mins (on an average) = 98mins-In this scenario of "Bathtub bath" its better to go for instant geysers since they provide hot water almost instantly and eventhough there will be pauses for every 3lts of hot water still the pauses being very small you'll have a bathtub full of water with enough amount of heat/hotnessThen you might ask what should we consider for "Bucket Bath" ?-Both "Storage geysers of 15lts or above" and "Instant geysers of 3lts or above" are good to go-Just choose based on:  Price,  Time taken to heat ( instant takes less time ),  Energy consumption ( instant comsumes less )Now coming to "Havells 3lts Instan Geyser of 4.5KW", why I bought this ?-Havells is a great brand-I wanted to have it for "Bathtub Bath"-4.5KW heats 3lts of water in just 30 to 50secondsWhat I liked about this product:-I have been testing it from a week and it is really ossum as it is heating 3lts of water in just 45seconds ( I have used a timer to note that )-The installation was totally free, however remember you will be charged if there is any "Plumbing Work" do be done.-No need to buy any extra accesories like pipes, everything is provided in the box, you just need to buy a 16amp plug which would be less than 100rs-As soon as the product was delivered by amazon, I got a message from havells saying they have registered my installation request and the very next day the instalaltion was done, thanks a lot Havells ( This might differ for you based on your location, I live in hyderabad)-I really like havells customer service-The geyser comes with 2 years of warrenty for the whole and 5yrs of warrenty on the tank-It has "Auto Cutoff" feature to stop further heating or wastage of electricity if you forgot to switch off ( however please switch it off once done because eventhough it has auto cutoff, still once the water in the tank cools down it will again start heating and the cycle repeats )-It shows color indication: "Blue when its heating" and "Orange when it has done heating" ( Have a look at the pictures I have attached)Note:-Go for the 4.5kw model if you want hot water instantly in 30 to 50seconds, the 3kw model might take 2 to 5mins to heat 3lts of water-Make sure it is 4.5kw model because I see reviews from other customers who say the "Mustard" colored geyser is not 4.5kw but 3kw ( better go for white and blue color to be sure )

Product Name: Borosil Easy Juice Cold Press Slow Juicer, Portable Slow Juicer, Compact Design, Less Oxidation, For Fresh Fruits & Vegetables, 130 W
About: About this item    SLOW SPEED EXTRACTION, MAXIMUM NUTRITION - The Borosil Slow Juicer uses low-speed (55 RPM) to squeeze fruits and vegetables ensuring no important fibre, vitamins and minerals are damaged from heat and processing. This kind of juice extraction prevents oxidation and help you get real-tasting and natural juice.    SLIM & PORTABLE - The small, space saving design of the slow juicer helps you to save counter space in your kitchen without compromising on the end results, that is, nutrient-rich juices.    POWER-ON & REVERSE FEATURE - Designed with a reverse motor action, mostly not found in conventional juicers. This feature helps clean any pulp blockages and also, ensures a better extraction process. 130 W MOTOR - Equipped with a higher motor power than most juicers in the same range, so that any ingredient you put in the appliance is juiced fully. Only dry pulp is left behind and your nutrition-rich delicious juice is ready to consume.    EASY TO ASSEMBLE & CLEAN - You can easily assemble and disassemble the machine for a thorough cleaning. The separate pulp outlet and juice jars prevent any kind of mess on the kitchen counter. Also, its compact size makes it convenient to store in a kitchen shelf.    Material Type: Plastic; Blade Material Type: Stainless Steel
Top Review:
Pros:1. Very cheap for a slow-juicer, they go for 6-7k with higher wattage so this is a good innovation.2. Works as expected for a slow juicer, gets you the maximum juice out of each vegetable you put and the waste is very dry and fully squeezed. The juice is thick as well unlike the other fast juicers which waste a lot of your vegetables and give very less amount of actual juice which is also watery.3. Carrots, apples are so easily juiced through, very efficient with them.4. Great warranty support, doorstep service. (Yes I had to replace once because Amla got stuck in it)Cons(and these are really heavy)1. You will have to cut your vegetables into smaller pieces because it cannot take whole ones, or even big pieces since the wattage is low.2. It struggles a lot with things other than carrots. Beetroot is tough and noisy but it can do it. However Amla(Indian gooseberry) is impossible to juice through it despite cutting in pieces, it is noisy and it finds it very tough to squeeze juice out of it. No question of handling denser vegetables and fruits3. There is a little bit of an adjusting curve with respect to disassembling and assembling again, it is a little bit of a hassle. Same with cutting vegetables, it is better to order a device that can cut vegetables quickly so that you don't have to do it individually.Overall:A. If you have a budget in this range- better to go for other type of juicers since they are less hassle involving.B. If you want a slow juicer itself, go for higher wattages and up your price range.C. If you want a slow juicer, and have a budget in this range, this is the best option.P.S- Many reviews mention that it doesn't work, please read the manual for that. You have to rotate and fit(with almost a click sound) the upper part(black plastic structure) into the transparent part on the side which has a lock symbol on it. The juicer will only turn on when it's locked.I hope this helped :)

Top Review:
ULTRA LONG REVIEW WITH LONG TERM UPDATES(so kindly bear with me)After multiple months I decided to buy a corded vacuum cleaner, I had purchased the Philips Corded Bagless Vacuum, upon arrival I noticed that the vacuum was extremely heavy even thou it was very well built, however teh suction was also very high and for basic tasks such as dusting and all is very very heavy, the main problem arises is that you shall get tired after 10 min of operation of the machine, also to operate it one needs to take out the entire machine connect it to a cord attach the heavy attachments, its such a chore so I realised all these negatives of the machine and decided to return it, am happy that amazon has an amazing return policy even thou I had used the product, thanks amazon......Now coming to the v8, even thou it was expensive I realised that this machine shall be used much more since its a cord free machine, I was skeptical that since its a cord free machine the suction would not be great, but I was so wrong about it, even on the lowest setting it has enough suction for day to day use, the machine is extremely light weight and its very easy to clean tight spots, since its a rechargeable battery I was afraid that it would not last much, however after speaking to the dyson customer care they said that its rated to last 10+ years since its not a fast charger and they take time to charge such a battery which shall help in the life of the battery,one more positive news that dyson are planning is amc which they plan to launch very soon, that gives peace of mind.Performance of the machines is superb, the amount of dust that this machine collects is unbelievable, I never knew how much dust is lying around the house, the attachments provided on the absolute plus model is superb all kind of tools are there for all needs, I don't think any other tool is further required for it, I think the only tool that is missing was the hard brush tool don't know why dyson does not even offer since it shall be really helpful to clean the car carpet.I'm lost for words for this amazing machine me being from Delhi where I dust pollution levels are extremely high this thing is a must have, however the cost is just a bit high and unaffordable for most Indian homes...... I think we can all buy phones worth 20/30k but shall always think multiples times spending something for health...... Lets hope my review is helpful for people planning to take the plunge....Shall keep on updating this review over time.....Update 1The cannister becomes frosty after couple of uses, however it does not impact in operation of the machine apart from the aesthetic side of it..... Regular cleaning shall be required of all the attachments since it gets dirty very fast due to dusty conditions in Delhi region....Update 2 - after 2 months usageWell I had a problem with the soft roller which shall be used mostly in Indian conditions since most of us have marble/tile flooring, so its the tool that I use the most often, however the tool started to make some noise for which i raised a complaint to dyson, the company is extremely professional in solving the problem, they asked me to make a small video and send it to them, after that they called me and sent their engineer & replaced the tool head no questions asked, this kind of service is unheard in India, I'm extremely happy about the customer experience, however what I worry about is the reliability of the tools etc, since warranty is of 2 years & i really hope dyson comes out with AMC facility since the product seems a bit delicate for daily usage......shall update more after 2 more months of usageUpdate 3: after 1 yearAfter lockdown due to the virus I've really started to use this machine to it's full potential, and I must say this machine is absolute worth the price that I had paid, I cleaned the entire house of roughly 2500sqft without my battery depleting completely, thou I used the machine in normal mode and not in full power, in some instances full power is required but certainly not always.....Basically two attachments are mainly used most of the time.....Update 4: after 1year 6 monthsSo finally have been using the machine to its max ability since post lockdown, one problem which started arising was that the heat was generating too much from the machine, for which i assumed that there was some problem with the filters etc, hence cleaned them and still there was extreme heat coming from the machine, upon further inspection of the machine I could see a crack starting to come below the trigger button.I immediately called Dyson service & informed them about this issue, to my utter SHOCK they collected the machine and returned it in less than 24hrs & changed the entire housing with a BRAND NEW housing, I'm simply lost for words about its amazing amazing service quality. This would be my FINAL update since I dont think I have any more input to give about this company, just one request that I would have with dyson was to release an AMC pack since the machines are very expensive & would want to protect it for a long time.

Product Name: USHA Quartz Room Heater with Overheating Protection (3002, Ivory, 800 Watts)
About: About this item    Meant for Spot Heating; Voltage/Frequency: 230V/50Hz/1 Phase    Room Size: Upto 150 sq ft; Ideal for a small room only, i.e., up to 120 sq. ft. Touch Sensor: No. :Tip-over Switch : Yes    Safety tip over switch cuts off the heater in case it tilts or falls; Powder coated finish to prevent corrosion    Designed for low power consumption; There are two heating positions to suit your comfort    Front grill for safety    Country of Origin: India
Top Review:
** First Impressions **● The heater is around 10 inches wide & 13 inches high and is weighs nearly 3kg● The body is in heat-resistant plastic and powder-coated steel. It feels a strong build and sturdy● There are two filaments enclosed in a stainless steel cage● There is a knob to turn the filaments on and there is a cut-off switch at the bottom** Usage & Performance **● When turned on, both the filaments gets heated up within a minute. The knob can be used to turn off one of the filaments to bring down the temperature● I live in Kerala where the lowest temperature in my area is never below 15 degrees in the night. I bought this for my grand mother and the room gets heated up pretty quickly. She turns one of the filaments off after midnight to control the temperature. I think this heater works well for a bedroom during sub-zero temperatures as well● The heater-body does heat up considerably after around half an hour and it is not very safe to touch when its turned on. You cannot definitely use this if there are toddlers at your home● There is an automatic switch that turns the heater off if the heater is knocked down. This reduces the risk of fire incase the heater tips over● There is a small handle at the back if you want to pick the heater up when its hot● There are certain precautions to be followed to ensure your safety while using this- Heater should always be in an upright position- It should not be used neat wet conditions- Power cord should never touch the heater when its turned on- Flammable materials like clothing or paper should not be kept infront of the heater- There has to be good clearance from the wall to provide air circulation● This consumes 400 watts on one filament and 800 if two filaments are turned on. So, be prepared to see your energy bills going up● Since there are no moving parts, the heater does not create any noise while working. This is the advantage I see for this over the fan heaters which are annoyingly noisy at night● It has got one year warranty, but I think filament is considered a consumable and may not be covered** I dont like these **● The filaments turn red and it emits a lot of light. I find it very annoying in the night. But since this is a filament heater, this is how it works and there is no other choice● The power cord should have got heat shielding sleeved protection. There are high chances for the cord to touch the heater body and this could potentially melt the cord● The steel parts of the heater I got had rusted here and there; I really doubt the quality of stainless steel used** Summary **● I have been using this only for a week now. I have seen a few reviews that says the filaments failed after a few months. So, I will comment on the durability of the heater after using this for a few months● I am very happy with the heating effectiveness, the build sturdiness and compactness of the heater. I paid Rs.1049 in Jun-17 and I rate FOUR stars. One star off on the points I dont like.

This is undoubtedly the best product I ever purchased for our house with my money. I bought this machine in Oct 2019 for 33K during the sale, also the best decision before the lockdown 2020 year began! My mother was sceptical if it will clean our oily and burnt bartan but she was impressed after seeing the shine. The plates are shinier than mirrors in our house, glasses are clean and perfect.SO here are the things you need to know before you buy a dishwasher.1. It is better than your household help/ domestic help (bai), it saves water and washes to perfection, you bartan are sanitized due to the high temperature after every wash.2. It takes time to complete the wash cycle as it rinses, soaks and drys all together, so better to load at night to have clean utensils in the morning.3. Do not use aluminium utensils as they will oxidise and have a film over them.4. If there is a problem with residue on your vessels it is probably an imbalance of salt or a badly performing rinse aid liquid. 5. Loading the utensils does not as much time as it would take to hand wash them. Once you know where your utensils fit it is an easy task. Maybe give this job to someone at your house who is good at organising and arranging things. I know men at home can be a great help in loading the dishwasher.Here are some of mine and my mom's personal tips:1. Wash all plastic, melamine, tupperware / and lightly soiled vessels in the quick cycle. This takes only 30 mins and the temperature is about 45 C so doesn't damage the plastic material.2. Use the top rack for all spoons, ladles, forks etc. The grey flap with slots (designed to hold the stem of wine glasses) is useful to hold spoons rather than the bulky basket. We never use the cutlery basket as it takes too much space. Lay serving spoons flat in the top rack one above the other facing opposite each other.3. Add a used nimbu (lemon) in the top rack basket handle for extra freshness and shine.If you've stayed so far, thank you for reading.Happy Dishwashing!

I recently purchased the Sanavya Freezer Door with Lock for my commercial kitchen, and while I am satisfied with the door's fitting, I do have some reservations about its quality and functionality.Firstly, the door fits perfectly into my freezer and the lock feature is a great addition for added security. However, I was disappointed to find that the inner glass coat required for freezing is missing, which can result in frost buildup on the door's surface.Moreover, the quality of the door is just average and not great. I have noticed some minor wear and tear on the door's surface after only a few months of use. This has me concerned about the door's durability over the long term.Overall, while the Sanavya Freezer Door with Lock is a decent option for those looking for a locking freezer door that fits well, I would caution against it for those looking for a high-quality, long-lasting option.

Top Review:
Experience of buying this in Gurgaon.I am writing this review to help the people, who have done a lot of research and either the other portals do not have feedback or if you are reading reviews on Amazon, every available Split AC is bad or pathetic.My feedback might help people in Gurgaon or Delhi more as I am not sure if the vendor or service partner is the same or different.I did my research about split ACs and found out most of the companies have bad reviews and when I thought that buying a split AC might not be a good idea, I realise that the chances of filling review by someone who had a bad experience are definitely more than the one for whom it's working fine. Hence, I am writing this one as an appreciation for Pansonic.Order process - I shortlisted this AC with a few other brands but in the end, looking at the Alexa compatibility and price, I purchased this specific model. I ordered the AC and it got delivered in a reasonable time of 48 hours.Challenge with delivery -  The first unit we received was slightly damaged and when the tech visited and suggested getting it replaced I requested the same (Amazon was a pain, story below), and the new unit came within another 48 hours.Installation - I read about a lot of issues related to installation with other companies but with Panasonic, I got the job ticket details on my WhatsApp within 15 minutes of delivery and the tech called me in another 20-30 minutes. I shared the timing details with the tech and they visited on time.Installation guy - Techs who visited my home were quite polite and took care of everything on their own, even including using the broom to clean the place. So, that was a great part.Installation fees - Disappointing thing on Panasonic's side, is that you have to pay for a lot of additional things, at the time of installation and while they are installing something that costs 35K, you can't deny small things like extra wire charges, drainage pipe cost, and extreme was the wire plug.Installation - 1200/-Drainage pipe - 200/-Wire - 390/-plug - 130/-Stabilizer - 1800/-Ac experience - Loving it as the cooling is pretty good & noise levels are really low.List of issues that are common with other brands -Delivery delay - Not an issueInstallation people not reaching out - Not an issueExtra copper pipe missing - Not an issueExtra Installation Cost - An issueRude Installation people - Not an IssueUnprofessional installation - Not an IssueAc noise level - Not an issueHope this feedback helps you with the buying decision and I hope my AC keeps on working fine, if not I will update this thread. :)

I am quite satisfied with the product. The gun itself is well-constructed and durable, and the 360-degree swivel feature is incredibly convenient for reaching those hard-to-get spots.The included detergent nozzle is also a nice touch, and it has made cleaning my driveway and patio much easier and more efficient. I've used this gun on several occasions now, and it always delivers a powerful and consistent stream of water.However, I do have one complaint about my purchase. When my package arrived, the box was noticeably damaged and it was clear that the gun had been jostled around during transit. While the gun itself was undamaged, it was a bit frustrating to receive a damaged package.Overall, I would still recommend the Bosch 360 Degree High Pressure Washer Gun to anyone looking for a reliable and effective accessory for their AQT or Aquatak high-pressure washer. Bosch is a trusted brand, and this gun lives up to their reputation for quality and durability. I just hope that Amazon can improve their shipping methods to prevent damage during transit.

About: About this item    Color: White and Blue ; Max. Duty Cycle 120 litres/day. Installation : Table-Top;Purification by hollow fiber ultra filtration membrane    Use of nano-silver carbon for better disinfection of water;Long life membrane expected to last upto 4000 Litre    Transparent tank made of unbreakable ABS food-grade plastic;High base stand enables easy positioning of glass to draw water; Ideal for entry level water purifier;WQA, USA gold seal certified    Warranty: 1 year on productIncludes: Water purifier, User manual, Warranty card and Service center details ; The image of the product is a digital image and there may be minor design variation depending upon various devices and screens    Purification Method: Activated Carbon; Warranty Description: 1 Year Manufacturer Warranty; Included Components: Outer Tank-01, Inner Tank-01, Bottom Stand- 01, Top Cover-01, Top Lid-01, Carbon Assembly With Inle
Top Review:
Kent's non-electric purifier is satisfactory so far. But one has to keep in mind that eventhough the capacity of the bottom storage tank is advertised as 10 liters, it actually stores only 5 liters of water. The reason is simple. The design of the Kent non-electric water purifier is faulty. The filter cartridge is kept hanging in the lower storage tank. So the filtered water drops from the upper tank to the lower tank due to gravity. Now when the lower part of the hanging cartridge is submerged in the water, the force of the dropping water is not enough to overcome the half-filled tank. So water stops dropping from the upertank into the lower tank. As a result, lower tank always remains half-filled only. Hence, one will get only 5 liters of water for use at any given time, eveif the upper tank is fully filled up.The second point to keep in mind is the taste of water. It tastes tasteless. May be because of the use of activated carbon.

 The fridge is very purposeful. I do not use it for eatables, I use it for my skincare products. It was the cheapest one available on the internet. I am using this for a week now. The only thoughts I had during this time were if only it was a bit bigger or had more sections. But that’s on me because the bigger ones are a bit expensive which I cannot afford. Other than that, the fridge left a lot of water based residue inside, which has to be cleaned regularly every few days or so, but I guess that happens when you put a lot of stuff inside which leaves no space for proper cooling. Hence, the water on the fridge’s floor. I am not an expert but I’m just guessing this stuff as every other customer.The delivery was very quick. I ordered it on 12th August and received it within two days. It had a proper packaging as well. I was afraid of the door being broken or the fridge not working at all like the other customers showed. However, this didn’t happen to me.To be honest, I am a bit shocked to see a lot of negative reviews about the fridge. It is a pretty decent one in this price range with an ample amount of features. We cannot get everything within a limited price in this capitalist economy based society after all!

The Godrej tag line is “ made thoughtfully in India” however many of the design features seemed to lack that.Having said that , the fridge itself works fine as a fridge and has good storage features that include accommodations for large and small bottles in the door , standard shelves and vegetable basket. The feature that could be better and were good in older models are the light , usually it used to be in front on the side wall and illuminated the fridge well , now it’s in the back and Center and gets covered by items on the shelves. The control used to be inside and may have been an obstacle to use these but still worked , now it’s outside and on the top and the door light switch sticks out like a sore thumb!. The lock is also at the top of the door . Guess it saved them the cost of punching a hole in the door and of having a metal catch in fridge wall. Now it’s a groove in the plastic.The worst improvement is a plastic panel that covers the feet of the fridge below the door, it unnecessary and flimsy and the press fit projections break at the slightest hit like when vacuuming or mopping

Product Name: Dyson Pure Cool Link Air Purifier TP03 (White/Silver), Wi-Fi Enabled, Large, Activated Carbon
About: About this item    Intelligent Purification: Automatically removes 99.95% of allergens & pollutants as small as PM 0.1 (0.1 microns) including dust, pollen, mold spores, bacteria, pet dander, VOCs and other harmful gases/odors;Dual Functionality: HEPA Air Purifier + Bladeless Fan in one. Backward airflow (Diffused) mode purifies without cooling    Senses: With two intelligent sensors, the Dyson air purifier continually monitors and reacts to air quality changes.;Captures: Dyson purifiers have a lower face velocity unlike some other conventional purifiers. This, along with the high-efficiency VACUUM SEALED 360° Glass HEPA Filter & Tris-coated Activated Carbon Filter ensures that harmful ultra-fine pollutants are NOT released back into the room & stay captured in the filter media    Projects: The only air purifier with Air Multiplier technology and customizable 90° oscillation;CONNECTED: Wi-Fi-connected home air purifier. See real time reports, remotely control your machine and create schedules around your day using the Dyson Link app. Alternatively, you can also control your air purifier through magnetized remote control    Voice Enabled: Alexa and Google Assistant controlled for easy operation of your air purifier and to update you on the indoor air quality;Features include easy scheduling, 10 air-speed settings, night-time mode, sleep timer, and an easy-to-clean aperture with no fast-spinning blades so its safe for little fingers or paws; Certified Asthma & Allergy Friendly by AAFA (Asthma and Allergy Foundation of America);Warranty - 2 years. Parts and Labour. Easy returns.    Material Type: Plastic
Top Review:
The theory behind the filtration is really quite simple. The Pure Cool Link pulls air through a fine mesh filter and fires it out through one of the company’s air multiplier fan designs.The 360-degree glass HEPA filter can capture up to 99.95% of pollutants - anything over 0.1microns. In the air trapped in the filter there is pollen, spokes, smoke, dust and other irritants. The filter also has activated carbon, similar to that used in cooker hoods, to trap any chemicals in the air, thus removing smells and pollutants.The cleaned air is then piped through to the paperclip-like loop, directing the air forward with force and sucking air through the back of the loop as it does so, amplifying the airflow.Controls + AppDyson Pure Cool Link review The small remote is easy to use and convenient, but all of its functions are also replicated by the Dyson Link app.There are two ways to control the Pure Link Cool. As with every other Dyson fan, there’s a small infrared remote for turning on the fan, increasing or decreasing its power, setting it to oscillate or operate on a timer. There’s also a button for putting it into night mode, which limits the fan strength to four or less and dims the LED display on the front.Pressing the “auto” button allows the fan to control itself in response to the quality of the air in the room at the time, turning on and cleaning the air when required.If you choose to the connect the fan to Wi-Fi – you do not have to – you can also control it using the Dyson Link app for Android or iOS. The app provides information on filter life, telling you when you need to change it – which is roughly once a year depending the quality of air in your house – and set schedules for it to run on a daily or weekly basis.Dyson Pure Cool Link review The Dyson Link app provides all the information you might need about your purifier and allows remote operation from anywhere with an internet connection.Users can also get an instant reading of the air quality around the fan and the air quality outdoors, and a chart showing air quality throughout the day or week and how often the purifier was active. There are also air quality targets that you can change, grouped into “good quality”, “sensitive to particles and pollutants” and “very sensitive to particles and pollutants”, which the machine responds to when automatically cleaning the air.OperationDyson Pure Cool Link review Setting up the Pure Cool Link is pretty straightforward using the Dyson Link app with a step-by-step guide.Using it is incredibly simple. Put it in your desired spot, plug it in, connect it to Wi-Fi using the app, which runs through a quick step-by-step guide then either hit the button the remote to set the fan in motion or switch it into automatic.As a purifier it works very well. It’s quite robust, so moving it from place to place –say in the living room in the during the day and bedroom at night – isn’t a problem. Appreciatively clearing a small living room of pollen for a hay fever suffer took only around 20 minutes or so and with the purifier set to automatic, it maintained a pollen-free haven even at the heights of suffering.It also removed smells quite effectively and while kept under level four out of 10 fan speed, was quiet enough to not disrupt TV watching or similar. There were occasions where the fan would kick up to level six or so, if not put into night mode, which made hearing dialogue difficult without high volumes.Dyson Pure Cool Link review The small screen on the base shows the fan speed, timer duration, whether the Pure Cool Link is in automatic or connected to Wi-Fi.As a fan the Pure Cool Link isn’t as effective as the Dyson’s other models. At the same fan speed it seems to push a smaller volume of air, meaning that to cool you from across the room requires it to be turned up pretty high. On level 10, the airflow is relatively strong, but it makes a lot of noise doing it, making it hard to do anything else in the room at the same time.ObservationsDyson Pure Cool Link review Two small buttons, one either side of the fan, depress to unclip the top loop from the base for cleaning and changing the filter.Changing the filter is a two-second job. Just unclip the loop using the side buttons, lift the metal sheath and slot another filter over itIt’s a statement piece of furniture in a room as much as a purifierThe remote magnetically attaches to the top of the fan when not in useThe remote is very much line of sight, more so than other Dyson fansLike most other Dyson products the fan’s noise is as pleasant as a fan can get, but still blocks out other wanted soundThe base doesn’t tiltThe airflow is more targeted and directional than a traditional fanThere’s only so much cooling a fan without air conditioning is capable ofThe air quality information is detailed enough to spot that the pollution levels in the front room increase when cars are driving past in the morning and evening commutesPros: easy to use, easy to clean and change the filter, excellent data read-out, simple remote, automatic monitoring and operation, scheduling, rapid cleaning, doubles as a fanCons: expensive, can be quite loud when pushed above 8 setting(Best left in auto mode for absolute silence). May not complement your decor.No dehumidifier.Does not remove odour etc smoke odour completely.P.N A desk top version is more sutaible for  smaller indian bedrooms as the tower is pretty imposing upto 3 feet in height.

Product Name: IONIX "Economical series" Whole House Water Filter & bag filter assembly bag filter 20 inch 5 micron Tank Filteration systems Sediment Bag filter 1 Piece Blue (1 Inch In-out with SS mouting plate)
About:
About this item    Jumbo size 20x4.5 bag filter assembly , Economical Range    Standard 1 inches inlet outlet is shipped in the package , If pipe Size is Less or more , One can purchase Reducers from any local hardware store , Seller does not ship Fittings along the product.    Can be used in any commercial RO , 100 LPH to 2000 LPH system , Filteration system is easy to install , Engage any plumber , just ask to connect inlet outlet to your Tank pipe , Inlet outlet fittings can be purchased from any local harware store for mere Rs.40 per piece.    Package contains :- 1 Sediment bag filteration assembly 1 inch In out , 1 Mounting Plate , wall screws, 4 mounting Screws , 1 pressure guage , 1 spanner    Do connect the filteration system after your motor , and before storage tank , Advisable to install on roof just before the storage tank , In flats you can connect to the main line which comes inside the flat.    This filter is suitable for connection to Monoblock / Raw water pumps upto 1 HP size , if you wish to connect to submersible / Other high pressure places , Search B09PJCSQW5 on amazon for high pressure bag filter    The system does not remove TDS or Iron from Water , The filteration process removes suspended particles & sediment , TDS means total dissolved salts that can only be removed by Reverse osmosis process, TDS reduction is not measure of water quality for this filteration system    
   This filteration system can remove Sediment from water , For Hardness filter , Search for B08JJ8CBP1 , For Scaling filter Search for B08TZVZL9X & If you have issues with Iron in water then search for B091PRHT6K on amazon. Compatible Hardware / Plumbing fittings are available on amazon , Please check your Pipe and and search for B0B3RKNKLC on amazon to buy Best quality Compatible Pipe fittings (please note that you need to first check the size of piping at your home (0.5 - 2 inch) and type of piping in your house (CPVC / UPVC / GI ) , Before you make selection for Pipe fittings through the given amazon product link. The supplied pressure guage acts as a indicator for filter getting choked , In most of the cases where customer has 0.5 or 1 Hp motor , pressure guage may remain to show 0 reading untill filter gets choked , This does not mean guage is bad , it means the water is flowing without any blockage in the filter , if you wish to check the pressure guage working , please close the Gate valve installed after the Filter and turn on motor , when the pressure will increase , guage will indicate the same.   Show More
Top Review:
I'll keep it short. It's a good filter and works as expected. But note a few things very carefully:1. There will always be some air leakage in this filter whether you notice or not. So, if you use it directly then I would suggest using teflon tape on threads (4-6 layers). For testing fill the water from pressure gauge hole and see if still any water is leaking from filter or not, if not then tight the pressure gauge. If yes, then reopen, adjust/reapply the teflon tape and tight again.2. Use two filters instead of one, as shown in attached photo. Left filter will block bigger dust particles, and right filter will block smaller particles which will get through from left filter. This way you'll have to clean right filter very less. Left one is very easy to open and clean. So cleaning will become very time saving.3. If you get a lot of sand in supply water like my case, then use these filters before the water motor/pump. In picture, left side is input of supply water, right side of blue filter is connected with input of the motor.4. Use union fitting so that you can easily remove these filters entirely and change by yourself whenever needed. Otherwise, you'll have to call plumber every time.5. Create a bypass connection too. So that whenever anything goes wrong with any filter, you can at least continue fulfilling your water needs. Otherwise you won't be able to use motor or water connections until these filters are repaired or replaced.If you this information useful then please contribute your information/learnings/review too so that I and others can also benefit from the same. Peace.PS: It's a short term review. Will update long term review later if I experience anything important which needs to be shared.

It really works patiently on clothes and takes its own time to wash (1-2) hours depending on the cycle unless you choose quick wash. This also ensures clothes are not strained during wash and prevents damage.10. Detergent tray has three sections- washing detergent, pre wash detergent, and conditioner/softener additives11. Emergency drain point and collector••••••••••••➖ CONS••••••••••••1. No wheel arrangement or stand out of the box (may be coz of the weight of the machine, wheels are avoided to have a stable base)2. Inlet pipe could have been a bit larger. I had to purchase an extension from the technician (~450)Deducting a star for the cons.•••••••••••••••••••🎛️ CONTROLS•••••••••••••••••••To connect machine to WiFi and enable app control-Download "SmartThings" app from playstore-Create/log-in to your Samsung account-Press WiFi button on machine-Search for machine using app and connect-App can be used to control machine and give washing commands, set mode, sping speed, temperature, rinse counts, etcDirect controls-Touch power button for a few seconds to switch it on-Rotate dial to select washing mode (Cotton, E-cotton, Shirts, Bedding, etc)-Touch respective buttons (temp, rinse count, spin speed) to customize selected washing mode-Use last contol (pointed hand) to customize further (Pre-wash/Soak/Intensive etc). Soak is the most used setting in my case which soaks clothes for 30 mins before washing-Press start/pause button for a few secs to start (machine locks door once it starts washing, wash can be paused in between using same button)-Do use good quality liquid detergent for quality wash (avoid solid detergent as sometimes it leaves a residue)•••••••••••••••••••❗ IMPORTANT•••••••••••••••••••- Use manual to understand washing modes and DO NOT exceed the load limit for each mode and follow instructions carefully- Put in any cloths (shirts, suits, kurtas, jeans, etc) with buttons, zippers, or any such extra accessories, inside out to prevent damage to the inside of machine- Do not leave cloths for larger duration once washing is done to prevent smell- Wipe drum, door, seal with soft cloth once washed clothes are taken out- Keep door open for some time (an hour or two) to let moisture out post taking cloths out- For some zones like collar, edge of jeans which are extra soiled, apply liquid detergent directly and rub a little••••••••••••••••🏆 VERDICT••••••••••••••••Front load is always a good option to go for since it replicates actual hand wash process and works great. This machine is a recommended device for the features you get along with quality wash. I have been using it now for a month and completely satisfied.P.S. Basic installation is free, but anything extra like inlet/drain pipe extension, stand, power extension, etc. is chargeable.

Else shop owners here were recommending VGSJW100 that can sustain up to 90V. But cost was double.The installation is just fixing plug in pin.  It is 4 amp Stabilizer so the plug can fit in any 5amp socket. VG 150 Supreme stabilizer offers high and low voltage cutoff functionality, automatically disconnecting the power supply when voltage levels exceed or drop below safe thresholds. This safeguard prevents damage to your refrigerator, ensuring its longevity.    Fail-Safe Circuit : Equipped with a fail-safe circuit, this innovative device immediately activates and isolates your devices from the electrical supply, effectively preventing any electrical mishaps. VG 150 Supreme intelligently restores power to your equipment once the voltage stabilizes, ensuring seamless and uninterrupted operation    Convenient LED Indicator: Monitor the performance of your stabilizer with ease using the convenient LED indicator. It provides real-time information on the input and output performance of the stabilizer, allowing you to stay informed about the power supply status.

I was looking for something to chop vegetables on a fly. Chopping via knife was time consuming & using some fix slider type or rope pull type mechanical choopers was unreliable. Searching a bit, i landed upon this category of motorised choppers.Having gone through a lot of similar types, i finally settled on orpat one & it turned out good.In short, its small & handy yet effective chopper with good ergonomic design. Using it for more than 3 months & it never disappoointed in the very task it is made for.**************INSIDE BOX**************1. Motor with 4.5 ft cord2. Transparent container3. Container lid4. Two blades5. Leaflets / warranty card*******PROS:*******1. Effective & efficient. Does a lot of work in seconds. Manually which may comsume minutes.2. Handy, compact & durable design3. Ergonomic soft push button, which stabilizes system when you push it vertically.4. Two types of blades for various jobs, chopping & whisking5. Works excellent with higher quantity of items, till upper level mark6. Heavy duty copper motor7. Separate chamber design, which makes cleaning easy without damaging motor, as its a separate unit8. Transparent container with cover which in turn have mini lid. It can be closed while storing items & opened while motor is fixed on it.9. Sufficiently long cord*******CONS:*******1. Proprietary plastic blades. Once blunt or broken, whole system is useless. One gets item for long term usage, but this problem limits its lifetime.2. High gap below blades, renders using device for small quantities close to impossible3. Chopper blade could have been 4 blade design, for further effective chopping4. Plastic propreitary gears for engagement of blade & motor. Once broken, will be close to useless5. Spare parts availability may be an issue due to above reasons.****************FINAL VEDICT:****************So finally, if on low budget & looking for good quality effective chopper, you can get this one without any second thought. Just use it wisely & dont overload it, as plastic construction of gears & blades though looks solid & durable, may not withstand it.Rest for normal usage, it wont ever disappoint you. Its used at my place on daily basis for chopping vegetables. Its like minutes turned into seconds. A kitchen person would love this product, as it saves a lot of efforts.If budget can be extended, you can get some model with 4 blade design only to be able to better chop low quantity of items inside. Rest Orpat one is good enough.

He explained the entire thing patiently and with non partisan approach. I was immensely impressed and one thing that I was sure of is that a company which can go to this extent to explain the USP of its products and assist you in making a buying decision will certainly ensure too if the class after care customer service which is paramount to me in making any buying decisions. After understanding that about the AC Motor, the durability of the machine and easily available parts, dedicated customer service and their passion for the product I decided to go for Hestia NutriMax finally.Yesterday I received my CPJ and from today my 9 day fast starts (now you know the urgency 😊)This morning I tried it on. It was damn easy to assemble. All details are given in the booklet attached with the product. I did as instructed and started with Mosambi Juice. Fantastic juice was extracted... just as I had imagined... and almost very dry pulp remains post the extraction of the juice. I tried putting the pulp back and juicing it again but not much had remained. My kids just freaked out on the juice and it was all so very exciting. No more going to the roadside mosambiwaala.Next I juiced a combination of carrots, apples & beetroot... the main purpose of my buying this juicer... as I intend to provide my family with the magic combo if immunity booster... it was so damn easy... didn’t even need to push the apples down.. it automatically pulls it in and voila... bone dry pulp out and thick juice this side out...  I am damn happy and pleased with the product. My better half was able to clean the same within 2-3 minutes post usage...I want to tell one thing guys, I did extensive research on all the comments here and also ran the same through some sites which are able to tel you the authenticity percentage of the genuineness of these comments... I am so finicky in trusting... but I have written all this so that it can help someone stuck like me make a purchase decision ... If anybody is still wanting to know more, I can be contacted at the Twitter id that is my is here or through this post... I will be happy to describe my experience and the process of deciding.I head the L&D function pfa fairly large customer centric insurance company and to me customer centric products as well as customer focused product providers only make sense in primarily deciding to buy. That is my understanding of this product and the people behind it.Thanks to timely overnight delivery but amazon... product sent as in the picture... intact and working Fantastic.I am really happy so far with this Hestia CPJ.. Hopefully it will help me lead a healthier lifestyle that I have been procrastinating for too long now... Also hope to juice more, reduce weight and be healthy...Thanks Hestia.Thanks Nehal& Thanks Amazon.

Top Review:
It works for a year and a half. Then it stops locking for toasting (does not lock for pop-up). I made a complaint. The technician came. Opened the sensor, cleaned it and it started working. After two days it again stopped. Mind it, we have been using other pop-up toasters for nearly four decades now and none gave such problems. That means, we know how to keep the toaster clean and remove the bread crumbs daily after use. Looks like there is a flaw in the design of Borosil toaster. It's sensor is located close to the toasting area and bread crumbs deposit on it. This is inside and you cannot clean without calling a technician. On my fourth complaint, the sensor was changed. It  is working now - not sure for how many days. The warranty expires in about a fortnight and then I have the option of buying a new one than to pay charges to Borosil for a bad product.Secondly, the stainless steel cover gets very hot and you run the risk of burning your hands. Overall impression : Frustating experience for a small product. Go for other superior brands.

Product Name: 3M Filtrete Anti Pollution Filter for converting AC into air purifier (White, 2 Pieces)
About: About this item    Captures PM2.5 like household dust, smoke, chemicals, exhausts, pet dander    Proven to capture 83% PM2.5 from indoor air in just one hour of use    Made with very delicate non-woven fiber composed of ~90% air, only ~10% fiber to ensure least effect on air flow and electrostatic charge on surface to pull unwanted particles from the air    Designed to cover around 80% surface of existing mesh of most models of ACs (to balance air flow and PM2.5 capture rate) – you may cut it smaller as per your AC size if you feel it is reducing air flow by large extent    Replace when the filter turns black for best results    Material: Non-Woven Fiber, Color: White    Item Dimension: 330mm x 210mm x 2mm    Removes PM 2.5 pollutants & Turns AC into air purifier
Top Review:
The attached photo says it all?Nope... Read to the endPros1. Works! Though I don't have a gauge to verify the claimed rate of purification/hr.2. Will certainly increase the life of the AC's internals.3. Can be used on an Air purifier (to extend the HEPAs life), Table fan (on the rear mesh), Air cooler and of course an AC.Cons1. They should've given a shade card, that works as an indicator for 'end of life'. No, seriously!2. It WILL reduce the airflow of the host unit and it WILL put some pressure on the motor too3. It doesn't say or seem washable. Although it may appear cleaner after washing there's no data to suggest what the drop in filtration would look like.4. Designed to work in a Very small room - 106 sq.ft. as per their own tests. (Further reading below)5. Not (relatively) cheap/affordable by any stretch of imagination! In most of India it will only last a month or less. So not only it is inefficient but also Expensive to replace! For reference, an air purifier can do duty for less money... and do a FAR better job at PM 2.5 removal (at least 16x better, even if it doesn't have a True HEPA). And a True HEPA air purifier will remove particles down to 0.01 micron (i.e. most viruses too!). That's 250x smaller particles than this product, And with a near 100% removal rate!--The one to the left (see image) was attached to an air purifier for 1 day and then moved to an air cooler (swamp cooler) for 15 days in a 140 sq.ft. room (1400 cu.ft.). For reference, I live in one of the cleanest and greenest societies in Pune.I shifted the product to an air cooler because I have a large one with monstrous airflow, several times more than an AC or even the most powerful air purifier.That will speed up the purification rate but not necessarily reduce life because there's only so much that will enter a small, relatively clean room, in a relatively clean part of a relatively clean city.So be realistic.It does what it says. Which by itself isn't anything earth shattering.And it's NOT cheap either.Mine greyed out in just 16 days! In a pollution deprived part of Pune - an already clean'ish tier 2 city!And i know it's at the 'end of life' because the reverse side has also greyed out (I mean the last of several fine layers).--One popular misconception is "What about the air that bypasses the filter, say from the sides of the host unit?!"Think... In a relatively sealed room, 'eventually' EVERY one of those PM2.5 particles HAS TO pass through the filter...  By 'eventually' i mean after a certain no. of ACH (Air Changes per Hour), if the filter is not choked by then, of course.'Clean air delivery' and room size math...Now, 3M has given us some numbers "83% PM2.5 removal in 1 hr" and if you read the back it says tested in a "30 cubic meter chamber", a *sealed* chamber of course.30 cu.mt. = 1060 cu.ft or a 106 sq.ft. room (assuming a 10ft height).They tested it on a 1.5 ton AC - a Gree KFR-35 GW run on 'High'. The model has a rated Airflow of 600 m3/hr, pretty much what most other 1.5T models will output.  A typical 1ton AC though will have a 15% lower number. Be sure to convert CFM numbers to m3/hr! (Divide CFM by 1.7 to get m3/hr)From there, you can extrapolate as to what the CADR for your room will be. Divide the airflow of your host unit by the airflow reference provided above and relate that to your room size to get an hourly PM2.5 removal rate.The CADR value thus arrived at would completely depend on the airflow of the host unit (air purifier, air cooler, AC or even a simple table fan) and assumes you have a sealed room!If you have an air purifier there are cheaper ways of saving your HEPA. If you don't, GET ONE!If you only want to protect your AC... DON'T GET THIS because you rather have that filter cleaned periodically than spend ₹315/month, you'll spend far more if you live in Lovely Delhi!In essence...At ₹150/month this *may have* made sense, for a *select few*.Though at >₹315/month its bonkers! because...● its a use and throw product.● won't last more than 2 weeks in a city like Delhi, maybe 2 weeks more (max!) in a city like Pune.● allows >16% of PM2.5 and also allows nearly 100%(!!!) of smaller particulate matter to still enter the room!● Bonus - It will reduce performance of the host unit too!

Top Review:
Update after 11 months of use -It stopped working after a smell of burning wires and then we tried to contact the Customer support. It took several calls and repeated reminders to get a technician to pay a visit. The home visit is worth 300 and the motor replacement is for 1200. The repair person checked and said the motor is fine but the timer has got spoilt and charged 450( after haggling)+ 300 . The machine runs but is not taking load. Earlier it could wash 3-4 heavy clothing but now doesn't move much with even two pieces.  Getting it repaired is turning to be costly.If I get the motor replaced now it will cost me 1500 + 750 from previous repair.....that's more than it's 3/4 cost price......  I am in a fix.... Should I buy new machine or spend more on this ??This is not a good deal if it gets spoilt ...My original review 👇I bought this for a young family member who just joined college in a new city and needed a washing machine that didn't occupy much space and is in budget.Now this has been in use for the past 15 days.Let's get on to the review.ProsThe machine is only a bit bigger than the average bathroom  bucket and indeed occupies less space. It is made of plastic body and is light weight and fairly tough. The quality of the material is decent and for this price point it is good. It looks cute and it is difficult to believe it can be a washing machine at first glance. There have been many curious visitors who had to see it to believe it.It is very easy to use with just two turn knobs. A washing knob which can be adjusted to get a wash cycle of up to 15 minutes and the spin knob to have a spin cycle of up to 5 minutes.A detachable Waterhose is provided to put water inside. There are issues with it ( see cons). Instead of connecting it to the inlet it is better to just put it inside the tub. If the machine is away from the tap then a regular hose pipe can be used instead.The machine can be filled up to 3/4 level. There is a drainpipe which overflows if you fill it more than a particular level and ensures you don't overshoot the level.The machine can take in good number of clothes. The first time it could wash 3 tshirts, 3 shorts/ bermudas, 3 pair of socks, 3 UGs and a kurta. And it can wash your double bedsheet or two pair of jeans easily. It is very useful for a single person or a family of two if laundry is done daily.When washing is over, the drain pipe is supposed to be lowered on to the floor to allow the dirty water to drain out. If you wish to spin it then it is a tedious job. You will have to remove all the clothes and then adjust the tiny spin basket and it has much smaller capacity and ( see cons). So what is better is to simply squeeze the water out by hands and then refill for rinsing. So filling and draining is done manually only.The machine does take some load off. It spins in clockwise and anti-clockwise directions and washes the clothes well. So one doesn't have to do any rubbing of clothes and lifting of buckets with this.It consumes very little electricity and can be run on inverter ..according to the seler ... which we haven't tried yet.ConsThe hose provided for putting the water in doesn't fit well into the slot. But can be just hung inside  the tub.The spinner is not good enough and even after the spin you can squeeze out water from the clothes. So it is almost a useless attachment.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Having said that this is still a good option for college students, single adults and a family of two. It saves you the trouble of putting hands in detergent, rubbing the clothes and lifting of buckets and draining water from the buckets .It is regularly available in lightning deals and you can go for it thenI find this machine to be amazingly simple in operation and design and a good bargain in budget.Hope my review is helpful to youThanks for reading.

Product Name: atomberg Efficio 1400mm BLDC Motor 5 Star Rated Classic Ceiling Fans with Remote Control | High Air Delivery Fan with LED Indicators | Upto 65% Energy Saving | 2+1 Year Warranty (Matt Brown)
About: About this item    ENERGY EFFICIENT BLDC TECHNOLOGY: Atomberg Efficio comes with an energy efficient BLDC motor. This 5-star rated fan provides a superior air delivery of 272 CMM with 280 RPM while consuming only 28W (at speed 5), saving up to 65% in electricity consumption.    ADDED CONVENIENCE OF REMOTE: Atomberg Efficio fan comes with a Smart IR Remote. IR remotes are easy to use without the hassle of pairing. Adjust the fan's speed or activate its unique features like boost mode, timer, or sleep mode at the click of a button.    CLASSIC DESIGN: Atomberg Efficio has a classic design that elevates the decor of your room.    BLADE FINISH: Powder Coated Matte Finish    2+1 YEAR WARRANTY: Atomberg Efficio ceiling fan comes with a standard two-year warranty. An additional one-year warranty can be availed by registering your purchase on the Atomberg website.    CONSISTENT SPEED EVEN AT LOW VOLTAGE: Atomberg Efficio ceiling fan runs with no drop in speed during voltage fluctuations ranging between 165V-285V, thereby maintaining consistency. It runs 3X longer on an inverter battery when compared to ordinary fans, allowing you to enjoy consistent airflow even during power outages.
Top Review:
Tl;DR: It is a good fan and I have been using for more than an year now. Buy it for the power savings and good service support, but not for the remote. Considering that I am willing to pay a premium, I would have liked to pay a little more and get an IoT enabled fan with WiFi for integration with Google Home (lot more convenient than their remote and you can do some cool automations). Unfortunately they have only released an IoT version with 1200mm sweep so I recommend waiting till they release a 1400mm version.I bought four 1400mm fans (2 white and 2 brown) to replace existing 1200mm Crompton traditional fans and installed all of them myself after removing the old ones. The fan rod that came with these fans is of high quality, but I couldn't use them as my old rods are fixed in through false ceiling. Even the bolts that come with this fan are a bit more sturdier that the previous bolts. The bolts are also a tad bit bigger, but they still went through the hole in the existing rod with a bit of a force.The installation was smooth, and 3 of the fans were well balanced, but the other was quite wobbly. I looked up the troubleshooting steps in the manual and tried the option to reposition blades. After trying all the 4 different combinations possible, the last one turned out to be stable enough. There is still a bit of a wobble, but not enough for me to worry.The fans do produce wind that is comparable to the traditional fans so we are not really sacrificing anything (except some Moola) to save power. The reason I replaced the old 1200mm fans is because they weren't pushing enough air to all corners of the room. These 1400mm fans do cover more area, so I have less incidents of mosquito bites overnight. For me, the main satisfaction is that I am using energy conserving fans. I also experienced their support/service and it is top notch. I would have given it 3 stars because of the below issues (especially because of the less usable remote), but adding one more star because of their great support/service:- Out of 4 fans I bought, I experienced issues with two of them, which is high as rates go (see below for details of these issues)- The finish on the fans could be better. If you observe carefully you would see imperfections and misalignments. E.g, the led indicator for the remote is not at the dead center for two of the fans, and I can see some gaps here and there.- The remote idea is attractive, but it is not really more convenient than 2-way switches. With 2-way, I have one switch right next to my bed and there is a regulator right next to it and I can operate both with my eyes closed. The remote is way less convenient, especially in the dark. In more than one instance, I pressed wrong button (there are two sets of the buttons, one for speed and another for sleep timer) in the middle of the night, even after turning on the light.- The fan does take noticeably longer to fully speed up.- There are some usability issues. E.g, if you quickly turn the wall switch off and then on (say, by accident), it will slowdown, stop for a moment before starting back again (though not always). This is annoying and confusing (especially to guests).Here are the service issues:After using for a few days, one of the fans developed a weird issue. It started making some sort of a "tak tak" noise. I could tell that the sound was coming from inside the fan, but it wasn't there all the time. Sometimes, there is no sound for several minutes and sometimes it is there continuously. I contacted Atomberg support and they quickly sent a service person. The service person was actually a very capable person, but he too couldn't understand it. After a couple of visits, he blamed it on our false ceiling. He did try something that seemed to reduce the noise for a few days, but it became unbearable again (hard to fall asleep and even sometimes wake me up), so I contacted back their support. This time, Atomberg sent me a replacement and the replacement fan looks good so far, no unusual noises.I have another fan developing another weird behavior. Occasionally, it shuts off, stops fully and then starts running again, all by itself. After carefully diagnosing this myself, I noticed that there is a small play in the way the fan rod was fixed to the ceiling (a poor job by our contractor) and this makes the rod turn in the other direction right after switching it on. Suspecting that this has something to do with the issue, I got a contractor to install a wood piece around the rod to make it sit tight and not move and the problem vanished (not a single such occurrence again after several months). It may be that there is a safety sensor in the fan that detected the unusual movement in the fan and briefly cut the power off.
