Product Name: Bosch 13 Place Settings Dishwasher (SMS66GW01I, White)
About: About this item    13 Place Settings: Suitable for families with up to 4 - 5 members, comes with Adjustable Cutlery box.    Bosch dishwashers are designed for Indian Kitchens and can easily fit all tyes of Indian utensils. No need to manually pre-rinse utensils before loading the dishwasher    Intensive Kadhai Programme– Perfected for cleaning greasy & oily masala stains    6 Wash Programmes & 3 options. including Half Load option- for fewer utensils, Extra dry option – For better drying efficiency    EcoSilence Drive: Energy efficient and quiet in operation with a particularly high life span
Top Review:
5-star based on about 4 months of use. Family of 3, used every day.Cleans 99% of utensils, except really burnt ones. Even milk vessel come out completely clean if placed properly.Even the one odd utensil, just need a little wipe with a scrubber.Great for cleaning chimney filters. Forget about caustic soda, hot water for chimney filter cleaning.Water consumption:-----------------------~4 liters in one stage, so about 12-16 liters for a full load depending on the program.Electricity (assuming 6 Rs per unit/KWH)------------------------------------------------All depends on the program you are using. It has 6 programs. You can modify each program by addons like vario eco, half load, extra dry.Had a spare electricity meter and rigged up with the dishwasher. Here are some of the mode I have tried using and measuring. Vario eco is a modification which increases the cycle time to optimize electricity without compromising wash quality. Half load never needed to use. Extra dry, never needed since we got all utensils dry without using it.Pre-rinse: 0.01-0.02 units - 6-12 paisaAuto: 1.17 units - 7.02 RsAuto+vario eco: 0.69 units  - 4.14 RsQuick: 0.59 units  - 3.54 RsIntensive kadhai+vario eco: 1.26 units - 7.56 RsEco+vario eco: 0.76 units - 4.56 RsWe use the Eco+vario eco combination and results have been exceptional. We have put all sorts of utensils aluminium, wood, plastic, disposable plastic, teflon and nothing really wrong happened in this mode. I feel that if there is no urgency vario eco should be used. Quick mode is not recommended for highly soiled utensils.Energy consumption is pretty much in line with the technical specification.Detergent, resin (salt), rinse aid-------------------------------------We have used finish and Fortune products.Detergent: We have used 2 Kgs in 4 months. One full load every day. In my opinion Fortune is good if not better than Finish. We have been using Fortune lately and washing has been good. It doesn't darken the aluminum as badly as Finish.Rinse aid: Usage depends on the setting. At a level set to 3/6, we have used 400 ml of rinse aid.Salt: Usage depends on setting. Our water hardness is around 760 ppm and the hardness testing strip suggested setting of 5/7. At this setting 1 kg should last 3-4 months. But if the hardness is high then this may need to increase. Salt consumption increases a lot at level 6 and 7. Yet to measure these levels. Not sure if it was the setting but the first pack lasted only for a week but then i changed the setting and consumption is quite less now. The last pack has been around for about 2 months now and still has about 30% left.If I calculate for Fortune products. It is 110 detergent + 30 rinse aid + 50 (max) for salt.Total cost of running assuming (Eco+vario eco+ 1 load per day)-------------------------------------------------------------------------Electricity  ~ 150Consumables  ~200At 350 pm, we do not have to put up with the constant threat of our maid's leaves, pay hikes. Quality of wash is far superior than hand wash.But since dishwashers are not so popular in India, getting consumables is a problem at offline stores not even the biggest retail stores seem to store them. But Amazon helps a lot. There are quite a few brands sold online, but plan for the lead time.Cons:-----1) It takes some time to learn to fitting all utensils. Results seem to improve over time.2) Loading takes about 10 mins if done at once. So you need to invest 10 mins everyday.3) Big household who need more than one load may have to run it twice.4) You need to depend only on authorized service centers for service. Don't expect technicians from outside will be able to repair this. But all brands who sell dishwashers are established brands and service centers are found in most places. Metros should not have issues at all.5) Cost of spares may be high due to low demand. But parts are supposed to be reliable. Only time will tell.6) fitting it under sink may be an issue. Check height, but doable if you are resourceful.There are lots of videos on youtube which explains the operation and loading. You can get an estimate of how many utensils you can load in one go. But none explained the actual cost of a typical use case.If you love to be independent, a dishwasher truly is indispensable. Hope this clears most of the doubt every new buyer has, like I had before.
Read more

Top Review:
We have a very big bedroom and are located on top floor of the building, so it can get very hot on summer nights. This has very good throw and cools the room easily in under 2 hours, post which we switch it off and go back to fan. However, if you were to use it entire night (say 8 hrs), the water will not even last for 2 nights. Also if you have a slightly high bed, because of the low placing of the overall drum, the air flow will be obstructed by the bed. You may then need to buy a pedestal which can be quite expensive (another 1K). I have somehow managed to arrange the vents after much trial and error to have the throw in a certain way. We are used to noisy fans so the sound does not bother us (my 2 year old sleeps beautifully with this on). Nevertheless, would recommend, since we tried a lot of desert coolers in the showroom and none of them could match this one's throw.

Top Review:
If you are looking for an all-in-one microwave with heavy usage or want to add class to your kitchen, this is the device to shop for. With a multitude of cooking options and additional features like a charcoal heater and rotisserie bar, it should definitely be a part of your shortlist.••••••••••••••••••••••🎁 INSIDE BOX••••••••••••••••••••••1x Microwave1x Glass Tray1x Rotating Ring1x High Rack & Low Rack1x Rotisserie Bar and Handle1x Milk Pasteurization Kit1x Multi Cook Tawa1x Owners Manual1x Recipe Manual (401 autocook recipes- codes to access autocook menu printed on the inside, visible once you open the door)1x Recipe Book (35 microwave oven recipes)1x Recipe Book (30 heart-friendly recipes)0x Starter kit (discontinued)•••••••••••••••➕ PROS•••••••••••••••1. Fully touch interface (except for the rotary knob, which has its own charm- its collapsible)2. Seamless design with one single glass panel visible on front (no extra buttons, pull handle, etc.)3. Door is hinged at the bottom and opens from the top4. Charcoal heater to give charcoal effect (though it may not be that effective and can't be a replacement for charcoal)5. Floral print looks elegant, and combined with seamless design, adds a different taste to the kitchen interior6. Beeps to provide feeback to touches and completion music as a cycle completion alarm- but there should be an option to disable it7. Child lock facility to prevent accidental run•••••••••••••••➖ CONS•••••••••••••••1. Led lights are not as effective as traditional bulbs, or more LEDs (currently 4) are required. While cooking in microwave mode, led lights are on, but nothing is visible. You must go close and create a shade to view the inside content. This wasn't the case with bulbs.It is sufficient for viewing content with the door open.2. Starter kit was discontinued by LG. (it's a nice to have thing with a few microwave-safe containers at disposal)Below are two things that are not precisely cons, but I felt it could be an option:1. Milk pasteurization kit can't be used for <1L qty of milk. I tried with 500ml, and it spilled on the glass try2. Ghee maker mode can't be used with malai direct from milk. You need to process malai to separate butter and liquid. Else it will be a disaster, and this is clearly being called out in the manual as well.For the two cons, I am reducing a star here as I felt that it's a major issue of not being able to the insides properly while cooking food, and a starter kit is always a nice addon for starters who don't have any microwave-safe utensils.P.S. It may not be a con for everyone. So, depending on your usage and personal preference, you may not find it an issue, and then it's a 5-star device.•••••••••••••••••••••••••⚙️ INSTALLATION•••••••••••••••••••••••••The best part is here. You just don't need to wait for any technician, and the product is ready to use. Just follow the basic instructions in the manual, and you are good to go.1. Place on a level surface, with a minimum of 30cm space on top and 10cm on the back for proper ventilation2. Connect to a properly earthed 15 amp socket3. Place rotating ring and glass tray inside4. Check the functionality- place ~300ml of water in a microwave-safe container, close the door, and press the start button two times.5. Check once the timer is over if the water is warm. Voila, the product is ready to use.••••••••••••••••••••••🎛️ CONTROLS••••••••••••••••••••••1. Touch controls for selecting mode- Microwave, Convection, Grill, Grill + Microwave, Convection + Microwave2. Separate touch buttons for different autocook menus3. Rotary knob to set cooking time, temperature, or power level4. Smart diagnostics button to be used only in case of an issue- to help service center with the diagnosis5. Start and stop button6. Start button doubles as a +30s button, to incremently add time to cooking••••••••••••••••••••••❗ IMPORTANT••••••••••••••••••••••1. Be careful and use only designated containers/utensils for different modese.g. microwave safe in microwave mode, and not any steel utensil or even multi cook tawa2. Check your requirements before going for this 32L microwave, as it's huge and bulky. Smaller ones may fulfill your cooking needs (<20L).•••••••••••••••••••🏆 VERDICT•••••••••••••••••••This microwave is a must-have addition in the kitchen and extremely helpful in cooking, especially if you love trying different cuisines.Even if you are not that into cooking, the microwave oven is good to have device and assists in different ways, such as warming food, baking, roasting, etc.

About: About this item    🌟 [STRONG 2700Pa SUCTION] - Variable suction strength that can be controlled from the Xiaomi Mi Home app. The Japan-made Nidec brushless motor with high power and powerful performance, to thoroughly clean the room without any dead spots. Once the dust bag is full, machine will give you a notification after which you can simply remove and throw away the disposable dust bag.    🌟 [LiDAR NAVIGATION] - 100% accuracy and coverage of cleaning in your house. Anti-collision sensors, anti-drop sensors, and wall sensors for smart navigation. Total 12 different types of smart sensors.    🌟 [INTELLIGENT ZONING] - Create No-Go zones, virtual walls, area-wise cleaning schedules, etc. from the Xiaomi Mi Home app. You can merge, divide, and name the map partitions. Multi floor mapping for upto 5 floors.    🌟 [PAN INDIA SERVICING NETWORK] - Service centres available in Mumbai, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Delhi, Pune, Ahmedabad, Chennai, Kolkata, Goa, Chandigarh, Jaipur, Lucknow, Trivandrum, Bhopal, Coimbatore , Cochin , Vijayawada , Madurai , Vizag, and Patna. More cities to be added soon.    🌟 [Package Content] - 1xCleaning Robot, 1xAuto Disposal Station, 3xDust Bags, 1xPower Adaptor, 1xReusable Wet Mop, 10xDisposable Mops, 1xMop bracket, 1x2-in-1 tank, 2xSide Brushes, 1xCleaning tool, 1xProduct Manual.
Top Review:
I am using Viomi SE since one year (Since 31st March 2022).  I am writing this review because it helps others to choose and decide.1. Suction Power: Very good.  Cleaning/sucking the dust is really good and sufficient enough for home.  When cleaning is completed by Robo, floor looks as if we mopped manually with the cloth.  My observation is, manually with the help of broom, we will never be able to clean very small dust particles.  We all know that only vacuum cleaners can suck very small dust particles.  So, this ROBO sucks even very small dust particles and hence floor looks very clean.  Suction & Cleaning I rate this ROBO 100 point out of 100.2. Mopping:  It has 2 mopping styles.  “S” Mopping and “Y” mopping.  “S” mopping is a simple mopping pattern.  Water in the ROBO tank flow slowly to the mopping cloth.  Cloth is attached behind the ROBO.  Cloth will wipe while ROBO is moving.  While sucking the dust, it mops also.  If the cloth that we attach to ROBO is very clean, then ROBO mops really well.  After 1 or 2 mops, cloth gets dirty.  Better to clean the cloth manually after every ROBO mopping.  If we have 2 to 3 such spare cloths, very easy for us to manage ROBO mopping.  It is natural that if cloth is dirty, cleaning will not happen well.  If you do Vacuuming and Mopping daily using the ROBO, then floor will be very clean and neat.  “Y” mapping intensive mopping.  ROBO moves zig jag in front and back direction; the way we manually mop using the cloth (left right, left right).  Hence “Y” mopping is very intensive.  But it take more time (Probably 30% extra time when compared to “S” mopping).  Why to worry about the time when ROBO is doing that for us.  We can sit and relax OR we can go to office while ROBO is cleaning our home.  But, after “Y” mopping the floor will be very clean and looks great.  In total I rate ROBO mopping function 70 out 100.  I rate 70 because, we can’t compare ROBO moping with manual mopping.  In manual mopping, we use 1 to 2 buckets of water and frequently we clean the mopping cloth multiple times while mopping manually.  We even add disinfectant detergent in bucket of water while manually mopping.  So, quality of manual mop is extremely good.  But the problem is we can’t do the manual mopping daily.  Am I right?  Who has time and patience of daily manual mopping?  You also know the way house maids do the work.  Usually maids mop the whole house in 15 to 20 minutes and run to next house.  But if you do ROBO vacuuming and mopping on daily basis, then floor is going to be very clean and dust free.  I prefer ROBO mopping over maids.  As we also can’t do the manual mopping on daily basis, ROBO is the best option.  If you are still not 100% on ROBO mopping, then you can do the manual mopping once in a month.  You efforts reduced a lot by using ROBO.  Enjoy the ROBO’s.3. Maps & Planning:  This ROBO can store many maps (I don’t remember how many maps right now).  Since I am staying in a Duplex house, I need to use the same ROBO on both the floors.  This ROBO has created 2 Maps.  One map for First floor, and another one for Second floor.  I manually move the ROBO to First floor and Second floor.  Select the map based on the floor that you wants to clean and press start in mobile.  ROBO starts cleaning.  Because this ROBO works based on the map, the ROBO will not leave even a single inch of the floor for cleaning.  ROBO will create the plan of cleaning and cleans each and every inch of the floor.  So, map based planning is really good.  Sometimes maps get distorted for unknown reason.  Probably because of internet disconnect OR when ROBO get stuck with unknown objects Sometimes my kid throw cloth and toys on the floor and ROBO get stuck with such objects sometimes.  But this is not a head ache.  ROBO can re create the map.  So, in such case, I will delete the old map and recreate the new map.  By this problem would be solved.  I have put Virtual wall in maps so that ROBO will not go inside the bath rooms.  I rate ROBO Maps & Planning as 100/100.4. Electric Power:  I am least bothered about electric power consumption.  I am not sure how much of electric power it consumes and also we can’t measure how many units it consumes in our home.  My house electricity bill also not much increased noticeably.  So, not worried about the electricity.  Nothing to rate here 5. Chairs and Tables: If you keep the chairs below the dining table, then ROBO can’t go below the dining table.  ROBO should have space to go below the dining table.  So, I will keep the chairs apart in such a way that ROBO can go below the table.  Once ROBO cleaning is done, I will move the chairs below the dining table.  This we need to do before starting the ROBO cleaning.  Not a head ache, but we can do this if we need ROBO to clean well.6. House Architecture:  This is very important point.  My house is little big (2 floors) and don’t have different levels.  I have seen few houses, where Living room will be in one level and Dining will be in different level.  Kitchen will be again in another level.  I feel, if house is in multiple levels, then head ache is more for us.  ROBO can’t climb up or down.  We manually need to place the ROBO in different levels.  I don’t have this much patience.  Luckily my house is a duplex house, but don’t have multiple levels.  Only 2 levels.  So, at one go, ROBO can clean whole of First Floor (Kitchen, Living, Bedroom, Dining, utility, Horanda, etc.,).  Then after some time I will place the ROBO in second floor.  Then ROBO will clean the whole of Second Floor including additional 2 bed rooms, Gym area, Study area, etc.,  Planning to buy another ROBO for Second Floor, but not required.  We can manage easily with on ROBO only for 2 floors.  Otherwise I will become too lazy 7. I also recommended my brother, Aunt and couple of friends to buy this so that they also get benefitted.  All of them are very happy with ROBO Viomi SE.8. Comparison with other brands:  Sorry, I have not used any other brand ROBO to compare with Viomi SE ROBO.  I used only Viomi SE ROBO in my house.  But I purchased this Viomi SE ROBO after comparing many other brands ROBO vacuum cleaners with their specifications in internet and many YouTube demos.  More than 6 months I studied about these ROBO vacuum cleaners before buying this brand.  Spent lot of time in analyzing.  Good that finally I purchased Viomi SE and I am very happy now.  You can also do the comparison of different brands for months and give some work to your head and brain and buy whatever you like.  Why I only need to scratch my head .  Now it is your turn.9. Rate:  I got this ROBO for Rs.18,000.  My friend and brother got it for Rs.19,000.  Another friend got it for Rs.17,000.  All of us purchased this in Amazon.10. I will share the photo OR video of ROBO after sometime if possible.  Don’t have patience after writing such a huge review.
